title: Field Technician (Marine Construction) RELO TO SEATTLE
full_description: Field Technician (Marine Construction) RELO TO SEATTLE Located in Seattle, we are a marine construction company that's been building structures around Lake Washington for over 50 years! Due to growth in projects, we are actively hiring a Field Technician who has at least 2 years of carpentry or dock building experience to complete construction tasks and general maintenance of boat docks!Top Reasons to Work with UsFull-time, direct-hire opprtunity $25-35/ hour (DOE)Relocation Assisstance Full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, etc)Exceptional retirement plan and more!What You Will Be Doing- Work with designers and planners on construction projects - Match materials to requested design specifications - Measure building materials and spaces for accurate installation - Ordersbuilding materials as needed- Create materials that fit the client's expectations- Assemble sturdy and well-constructed dock framing - Incorporates fixtures like boat cleats, ladders, bumpers, fenders, brackets and boat whips - Builds temporary housings and supports for setting concrete - Combines carpentry work with joining work - Repairs and refurbishes existing building work - Replaces damaged wood - Uses power tools and other tools to cut and shape wood, metal, and other materials - Communicates with the rest of the construction teamWhat You Need for this Position2+ years of carpentry or dock building experience Understanding of best building practices and job-site safety regulations and requirements Ability to read blueprints, drawings, and sketches and fully grasp requirements Accuracy taking measurements and calculating the size and amount of material needed for a project Skilled in the use of all the tools necessary to cut, shape, and smooth lumber and other materialsAbility to assemble/build boat docks Basic understanding of MS Office and industry software..So, if you are a Field Technician with carpentry experience, please apply today and email caroline.veillon@cybercoders.com with the best time + number to reach you. - Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work â€“ In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
